TopicTitle: Hi guys... and a noticeable dilemna

Articles.Content:
So I\'ve just started with the demo version. 

Excellent thinking simulator... you get what I mean.

within two attempts I had my own orbit going... four radial coupled 4x stack fuel tanks. Simple, but effective.

so just a good half hour ago i tried something ... Look at the image..

Three tanks on a radial coupler, but each tank is separated by a stack decoupler...

I figured it would make a lot of sense... it didn\'t .

I should have seen it coming, but the second I tried to decouple tank 3 from 2, they collided and exploded. 

However, it does make a lot of sense... Once a fuel tank is exhausted, jettison it for less mass and still keep the same engine propelling you with another tank. 

anywho, i\'ve got my next idea in the works to link each fuel tank separately by radial decups to the main thrusters but link them with fuel lines to the tank below.. We\'ll see how that goes..

I will enjoy being a part of this sim and community..

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

I don\'t see how your fuel lines could get to the next stage. They would just connect to the decoupler, which does not allow fuel through.

Welcome to the forums.
But if you do that, the engines would decouple too
